title: NATO Allies Discuss Arms Supply for Ukraine as Battles Loom
description: One of Ukraine’s biggest problems in fighting the Russian invasion is a basic one: It is firing artillery rounds much faster than its Western backers are producing them.

title: Health and Environmental Fears Remain After Ohio Derailment and Inferno
description: Experts say more work could be needed to determine the consequences after a release of toxic chemicals from a Feb. 3 train crash.

title: New Zealand Calls State of Emergency for Cyclone Gabrielle
description: The cyclone, which caused severe flooding and cut power to 225,000 residents, was “the most significant weather event New Zealand has seen this century,” Prime Minister Chris Hipkins said.

title: Ukraine Urges Civilians Out of Bakhmut as Russia Edges Closer to City
description: Fewer than 5,000 residents remain in the eastern city, out of a prewar population of 70,000, as Russian forces close in.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Miracle Rescues in Turkey
description: Also, the balloons over the U.S. and India’s raid on the BBC’s offices.

title: European Union to Ban Gas-Powered Cars by 2035
description: The law is part of the E.U.’s ambitious plans to make the 27-member bloc carbon neutral by 2050.

title: 9 People Rescued in Turkey Nearly 200 Hours After Quake
description: Among those rescued were two brothers who ate protein power and swallowed gulps of air, rare bright spots in one of the bleakest periods in memory for Turkey.

title: Jewels in Camilla’s Crown Will Not Include Famed Diamond Claimed by India
description: For the coronation of King Charles III and the queen consort, she will wear a century-old crown that does not include the storied Koh-i-Noor diamond, taken from India under British rule.

title: What to Know About Israel’s Planned Judicial Reform
description: The government says its plan is a much-needed reform to curb the influence of an overreaching judiciary; critics say it will undermine the country’s democratic institutions.

title: U.S. Arrests Three Americans in the Assassination of Haiti’s President
description: Antonio Intriago, a Venezuelan-American businessman, and Arcángel Pretel, a Colombian American citizen, are the owners of a Florida-based security company that has been tied to the 2021 killing.

title: Earthquakes Destroy. People Rebuild.
description: Cities are a form of life and they need constant care to stay strong. They didn’t get that care in Turkey.

title: Netanyahu’s Judicial Overhaul Plan Divides Even Israel’s Religious Right
description: A plan to limit judicial influence set off a rancorous debate, mass protests and even fears of political violence. Now, some among the government’s religious right-wing base are breaking ranks.

title: Greece Border Abuses Highlight Europe’s Clashing Priorities on Migration
description: The top rights officer at Europe’s border agency said in a confidential report that it should stop working with Greece because border guards there were mistreating asylum seekers.

title: Moldova Briefly Closes Airspace After President Accuses Russia of Coup Plot
description: The national carrier, Air Moldova, confirmed the closure but did not provide an explanation. Two hours later, it said the airspace had reopened.

title: Nigerian Election 2023: What to Know
description: The presidential election this month in Africa’s most populous country is completely unpredictable. An unexpected third candidate with a huge youth following may upend decades of traditional politics.

title: 3 Men Rescued in Turkey Nearly 200 Hours After Quake
description: The first 72 hours are critical for finding survivors after natural disasters. The men rescued in Turkey on Tuesday had been under rubble for nearly 200 hours.

title: A balloon and 3 U.F.O.s
description: What is the U.S. shooting down? Here’s what we know.

title: Quake Updates: 3 Survivors Rescued in Turkey; Aid Groups Urge More Help for Syria
description: The combined death toll in Turkey and Syria rose to nearly 36,000. But in a hopeful note, three survivors were pulled from the rubble in Turkey and Syria’s leader opened more border crossings to let aid in.

title: Ukraine’s Ammunition Needs Top Agenda as NATO Defense Ministers Meet
description: A two-day NATO meeting and another with a larger group of Ukraine allies are part of a series of diplomatic gatherings this week.

title: Indian Tax Agents Raid BBC Offices After Airing of Documentary Critical of Modi
description: The authorities under Prime Minister Narendra Modi have often used such raids in what activists call an effort to silence dissent.

title: When a Visit to the Museum Becomes an Ethical Dilemma
description: Western museums are major tourist attractions, drawing travelers from around the world. But what responsibility do we bear as spectators for patronizing institutions that display what critics say are stolen works?

title: Isolation and Resignation in Turkish Villages Hit by Earthquake
description: In rural southern Turkey, some villages were cut off from aid for days, and locals were left to fend for themselves.

title: After U.S. Downs UFOs, More Awareness of Balloons All Over Our Skies
description: As more unidentified objects were shot down by the U.S. Air Force in recent days, experts warned that there were an “endless” array of potential targets.

title: One of the World’s Cleanest New Skyscrapers Collides With the Future
description: One Vanderbilt, in the heart of New York City, is built to be especially climate friendly. But the design landscape and city rules have changed quickly.

title: Italy’s Hard-Right Leader Vexes Europe by Playing Nice, Mostly
description: Some still fear an authoritarian turn, but Giorgia Meloni has surprised many by showing a pragmatic streak since coming to power. Now Europe is not sure what to do.

title: The Toll That Twitter’s Glitches Is Taking on Chinese Activists
description: As the Elon Musk-owned social media service encounters interruptions and bugs, Chinese dissidents and activists said they feared they were being muzzled.

title: China Tries to Depict Furor Over Spy Balloon as Sign of U.S. Decline
description: Ignoring charges of spying, Beijing says Washington’s “overreaction” is a symptom of the country’s broken politics.

title: Guided Missile Killed U.S. Aid Worker in Ukraine, Video Shows
description: A Times analysis suggests that an intentional strike, not an indiscriminate attack, most likely killed Pete Reed. It is unclear whether the attackers knew he was with a group of aid workers.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Protests over proposed judicial changes in Israel.

title: Secretive Network Rescues Russia’s Antiwar Dissidents in Nick of Time
description: Hundreds of people facing long prison sentences are being spirited out of the country by groups that arrange daring escapes, with one trip using six different cars over more than 4,000 miles.

title: A Surprise Pick to Lead the Bank of Japan Faces a Wrenching Choice
description: Kazuo Ueda is set to replace the longtime governor who helped put the country on an unorthodox monetary path. Will he change course?

title: U.S.-China Tensions Rise Over Spying Programs As U.S. Investigates UFOs
description: The Biden administration is looking into mysterious U.F.O. encounters and pushing back against China over accusations of widespread espionage.

title: As Russia Closes in on Bakhmut, Ukraine Bars Aid Workers From the City
description: With Moscow’s forces closing in, the besieged city is too dangerous for the volunteers, Ukrainian commanders said, in what could be a prelude to a Ukrainian withdrawal.
